overview.problemStatement:
Forum

Let $A\subseteq\mathbb{N}$ be infinite and $d_A(n)$ count the number of $a\in A$ which divide $n$. Is it true that, for every $k$,\[\limsup_{x\to \infty} \frac{\max_{n<x}d_A(n)}{\left(\sum_{n\in A\cap[1,x)}\frac{1}{n}\right)^k}=\infty?\]



The answer is yes, proved by Erd\H{o}s and S\'{a}rk\H{o}zy \cite{ErSa80}.




References


[ErSa80] Erd\H{o}s, P. and S\'{a}rk\"{o}zy, A., Some asymptotic formulas on generalized divisor functions.
IV. Studia Sci. Math. Hungar. (1980), 467-479.
